intro: Pilea semisessilis, commonly known as the Shangri-La plant, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves that are often variegated with silver or white markings. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Pilea semisessilis is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
